intro: Boechera parishii, commonly known as the Parish's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in early spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
